resources.string: A verification link has been sent to your email. Please verify your account before logging in.
If you would like to change your password then please enter your email. A reset link will be sent.

At the Government announcement of the National Lockdown we realised we were in a desperate situation with over 350 dogs at the Farm and no way to feed them or care for them without our usual visitors or funds.

Our lockdown foster program was the first in our history and by March 26th over 200 dogs left the farm to go to their foster homes. With the addition of new litters, new rescues and pregnant mommies, that number quickly grew to approximately 275 dogs and puppies in foster care.

Since late March a little over 150 dogs that were in foster care have been adopted, half of those were young dogs or puppies but 50 % were mature adults dogs and 10 % were dogs with medical and behavioral issues.

That means that 77 dogs that would normally never have had a chance at the Farm, have found a home due to having been in Foster care. That is huge and we are immensely grateful to our fosters and adopters alike. We still have about 125 dogs in foster care, 25 of those are puppies that will or have already been adopted. Out of the 100 remaining dogs about half are potential foster fails, have applications or are with fosters that can keep them indefinitely.

All in all this has been a huge success and we would like to thank all of you for making this happen. Please join our Fallen Angels Lockdown Fosters Facebook page if you would like to follow our foster dogs and their amazing journeys.
For most of them, their story has just begun!
Map to Fallen Angels Pet Rescue Farm. (Please do not use Google Maps)
SOUTH AFRICA’S FALLEN ANGELS WIN FIRST BRIAN DAVIES AWARD FOR ANIMAL WELFARE

Named after legendary animal welfare pioneer Brian Davies, The Brian Davies Award is a new annual award made to an animal welfare organisation that has managed to significantly help animals, in difficult and challenging circumstances. It carries a $10,000.00 prize.
Finalists came from Greece, Uruguay and South Africa. Network for Animals (NFA) organised the awards and asked supporters to vote for the most deserving. More than 10,000 people voted.

Fallen Angels is a group of women who venture into South Africa’s poverty-stricken and lawless townships to treat, rescue and rehome street dogs. Their Fallen Angels shelter in the Western Cape now cares for 328 dogs.
“I went to visit today and I was struck by the friendliness of the staff and the lovely happy condition of the dogs. such a happy atmosphere all round. awesome bunch!”
"Well done ladies. It was a fantastical day at Willowbridge yesterday. You are passionate caring amazing people"

Such an amazing shelter! We have adopted a doggo from here in the past & he has grown so beautifully, we couldn"'"t imagine life without him!!! The love & care you give these animals is amazing. keep up the good work! ♡"
"We visited for the first time today and I just wanted to take all of the doggies home with me! Keep up the amazing heartwarming work you guys are doing and we WILL be back"
"Visited today & all the dogs are well looked after and happy...even got to play with a couple of them in the field..definitely worth a visit."

"I volunteered at Fallen Angels this week with one of my friends and I can honestly say I had the time of my life. The farm-staff are extremely friendly and are doing such an incredibly good job at looking after those animals. They’re as happy as shelter animals can be. Charmaine, Craig and Princess Bonnie are the friendliest faces to see on that farm!"
"We just adopted a beautiful staffie from fallen angels. They did all the right things. Home inspection, introduction to kids, taken the time to match him for all the right reasons. Well done..."

"We have never met such caring people before. You can tell everyone there puts their animals first - making sure they are cared for correctly. Thank you for the wonderful advice and most of all for our beautiful new family member Phoenix"
"These people do such an amazing job with what little they have, Lifesavers for our furry friends."

"Thank you so much for our precious Angel we adore him and thank you to all involved especially Stef who patiently helped us match our Roxy to Benji - they are inseparable now. Really would encourage anyone to support this wonderful organization ❤"

"I have never seen such a well organised pet rescue institution in my life and my own sister runs a rescue shelter. The friendliest, most helpful staff with an amazing amount of knowledge, expertise, love and care about and for all the incredible animals on the farm. Keep up the heavenly work and thank you for taking care of all our furry, four-legged angels."

Our furry angels deserve and get only love, food, tenderness and care from our well trained staff. In fact, our staff live with most of our dogs so as to establish a bond with our angels like at no other rescue organisation. This makes for a mutual bond between our staff and the beautiful creatures that we can all love and save.
There are so many ways that you can help our animals. We could not do what we do without all our amazing volunteers. Become part of the Fallen Angels team today!

Raise money for charity and help us care for sick, abandoned and unwanted pets. You can do anything, from challenging yourself with a sponsored run to organising a tea party! Fundraisers are one of the most effective ways to spread the word about us, and raise money at the same time. Fundraising for Fallen Angels Pet Rescue is a very rewarding experience. Not only will you be helping sick, injured and homeless pets but you will have a great time doing it! Whatever event or challenge you decide to organise or take part in, we’ll support you in every way that we can. Fundraising is a great way to gain new skills and meet friends. On top of that, fundraisers are tax deductible and a great way to show awareness of the cause through your company. 100% of our donations go towards helping our animals find better lives.

Why not order a collection box for the reception at your work or ask if you can put one in your local pub, newsagent or vet? Bake some cakes and sell them at work, school or to your friends Have a swear box in your office, or pick a popular word instead and charge everyone that says it Hold a sponsored ‘give something up’ day. Friends and colleagues could give up chocolate, tea or even talking! Hold a lunchtime quiz at work or school Why not do the washing up for a week and ask for a donation? Hold a ‘Come Dine with Me night at home with your friend or family and charge them to dine

We’d love for you to organise your own fundraising event for us and we’ll do what we can to support you. There are lots of different events you can hold, and here are a few ideas to get your imagination flowing!

Are you cleaning out your closet or redecorating your home and have unwanted items? Please think of us. Everything that you think can aid us in raising funds for Fallen Angels is welcome at our charity shop! We gratefully accept anything resalable or usable, for example:
All of the money raised by us selling your clothes in our Blue Cross shops will go towards helping pets.

Our main mission is to save and improve the living conditions of animals in their immediate surroundings, while maintaining their rehabilitation. This may involve re-homing animals who are unwanted, unloved or lost (mostly focusing on township animals, but not limited to). Ultimately the rehabilitation of animals will involve children, which will then act as therapy for both the children and the animals.
Some of our furbabies in their very own, forever homes. This is what melts our hearts
Amazing what patience, love, nutrition and vet care can do ! Especially with your support and donations.
Come for cuddles at our weekend adoption days. Keep an eye on our facebook page for where we are.
Our amazing doggy bootcamp volunteers. Join them every weekend bright and early on the farm.
Bring the kids and come spend some time with our doggies on our farm.

Our Outreach Program entails partnering up with "Network For Animals" and provides us the opportunity to visit empoverished areas providing free, veterinary care, yummy food and rescue for animals in need. We also visit schools and educate children on pet care.
Our annual Nelson Mandela Day functions are held at Fallen Angels Pet Rescue and embody the true spirit of South African generosity.
Our annual Doggy Christmas Party, held at Fallen Angels Pet Rescue, is an extraordinary site to see. Come experience our unique doggy, gift unwrapping
Portion 25/19 of the farm Kleine Zoute Rivier 1063

Fallen Angels Pet Rescue is a registered NPO (NPO 175-638) focusing on the rescue, rehabilitation and rehoming of domestic animals. Any animal that is forgotten, abandoned (abused), lost, lonely, emaciated and neglected (FALLEN) is considered to be a Fallen Angel & therefore part of the focus area of this organisation. Through animal therapy they aim to assist in healing the broken souls of any \"FALLEN Angels\" they are financially able to assist.
Fallen Angels Pet Rescue was founded in February 2014 by three devoted people; already active within the animal rescue and rehabilitation circuits.

We are situated in Melkbosstrand and we work hard to make sure that all the animals in our care get the love, attention and adoration that they deserve. We have many volunteers that help, which we are all too grateful for. Our aim to make sure that the animals in our care get homes that will give them the comfort that they deserve. It"'"s been a long and hard journey, but one that is worth it every day.

The "'"FALLEN"'" in Fallen Angels Pet Rescue stands for Forgotten, Abandoned (Abused), Lost, Lonely, Emaciated and Neglected. Any animal that falls under these categories is considered a ‘Fallen Angel’ and thus falls within the area of importance for this organisation.

Our furry angels deserve and get only love, food, tenderness and care from our well trained staff. In fact, our staff live with most of our dogs so as to establish a bond with our angels like at no other rescue organisation. This makes for a mutual bond between our staff and the beautiful creatures that we can all love and save.
Please sign in or create an account to continue
These gorgeous furbabies are looking for their very own, forever homes. If interested, select a furbaby and proceed with the following steps.
Looking to adopt or foster? Select one of the options below!
ADOPTION FEE FOR ADULT CATS AND DOGS IS R1000
ADOPTION FEE FOR PUPPIES AND KITTENS 0-12 IS R1250
TO BE PAID INTO OUR ACCOUNT PRIOR TO THE PET"'"S ARRIVAL
Would you like to be on our mailing list?
Ages of children staying in your home?
Do you have any other Animals? How Many?
How many of your animals are sterilised?
If not sterilised, please provide a reason
Did any of your animals have a litter before sterilisation?
Are your pets (cats & dogs) fully vaccinated?
What diet are your pets on?
Quantity hours pet would be alone for during the day?
If someone is at home during the day, who are they and for how long?
Why do you want to Adopt this pet?
Have you ever surrendered your animal to a rescue org or given a pet away? If so, why?
What happened with your previous pets?
Have any of your companions gone missing?
Are you prepared to provide a PERMANENT home for the duration of this animal"'"s life?
Are you willing to teach your pet about digging, chewing, potty training, etc?
Who is responsible for your pets when you go on holiday?
What will happen to your pets should your circumstances change? i.e., Loss of job / move into a place that does not allow animals? Can you appoint God Parents for your pet?
Where will the dog/cat sleep at night?
If outside, what shelter will be provided?
If animal will sleep outside, will they be allowed inside and when?
Do you have a FENCED / GATED yard?
Do you have a pool. If YES, is the pool secure?
How often will feeding take place?
What size garden will the animal have?
Do you have time to play, walk & groom your dog/cat on a daily basis?
Have any animal died on your premises due to Parvo / Distemper? If so, how long ago?
Are you able to provide Vet care, quality pet food, & grooming for your pet?
Do you understand that your pet must be vaccinated yearly, dewormed every 6 months and be treated for ticks and fleas every month (at your own cost)?
Do you understand that your pet MUST be sterilised at the age of 6 months old?
THANK YOU FOR CHANGING THIS FUR ANGEL"'"S WORLD!!
